intro: Cuphea gracilis, commonly known as the slender cuphea, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Cuphea gracilis is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
